thread.title: Cardinals Complete an Undefeated November

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Cardinals Complete an Undefeated November
text:
Cardinals Complete an Undefeated November
The University of Louisville men's basketball team defeated NJIT 104-47, improving to 7-0 this season, marking their best start since 2019-20. Ryan Conwell led with a season-high 32 points and 9 rebounds, contributing to the team's fourth game scoring over 100 pointsâ€”something not achieved since the 1989-90 season. The Cardinals dominated the first half, ending with a 52-20 lead and showcasing their depth with multiple players scoring in double figures.
- Louisville shot 20-of-48 from 3-point range, just two shy of a program record.
- The Cardinals had a 38-rebound margin, totaling 59 rebounds against NJIT's 21.
- Louisville's 7-0 record is the best start for the program in three seasons.
- They have averaged over 100 points in four games so far this year.
The Cardinals will next face No. 22 Arkansas on December 3 in the ACC/SEC Challenge, where they will look to extend their undefeated streak.
Bottom LineWith their dominant performance and deep scoring, Louisville is establishing itself as a formidable force in men's basketball, aiming for continued success as they approach tougher matchups.
Read more at University of Louisville Athletic
